Package view_control

Class LoginWindowController

java.lang.Object
view_control.LoginWindowController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class LoginWindowController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Version:
1.0 Contains methods for validating user credentials, adjusting the program language based on the users' region, and logging the user in to be able to use the program.
Author:
Brayden McArthur

      public LoginWindowController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
      Tries to create a test user to setup the test account for logging in. If it is already created a message is printed indicating the account is already created. If not, it creates the user in the database and confirms it by printing a message.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - A URL
      resources - The resources to be used based on the users' region setting.

    • loginButtonClicked

      public void loginButtonClicked() throws java.lang.Exception
      Checks that the username provided matches a username in the users table of the database. If it doesn't an alert box is displayed telling the user that the username does not exist. If it does exist, the password is then validated. If the password and username are in the same row in the database, the user is logged in successfully. If the password does not match the username, an alert box is displayed indicating a bad password. Also creates a log file in the root folder of the Program to record successful or unsuccessful logins.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in Fetcher, validateUsername(), validatePassword(), getCurrentUserId(), or setMainWindow().

    • setUsername

      public void setUsername​(java.lang.String username)
      Sets the username.
      Parameters:
      username - A string to store the username.

    • setCurrentUser

      public void setCurrentUser​(int id, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Creates a user object that is used throughout the program to tell the database which user added/updated customers and appointments.
      Parameters:
      id - An integer obtained from the User object.
      username - A string obtained from the User object.
      password - A string obtained from the User object.

    • setMainWindow

      public void setMainWindow() throws java.io.IOException
      Changes the scene to the main window where the user can use the program.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws IOException if there is an error loading the FXML file.

    • quitButtonClicked

      public void quitButtonClicked()
      Closes the stage object which terminates the program.
